info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MIFFLIN... SOUTHEASTERN CENTRE...WEST CENTRAL SNYDER AND SOUTHWESTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Bellefonte, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zion, Milesburg, Millheim, Aaronsburg, Rebersburg, Spring Mills, Coburn, Troxelville, Madisonburg, Belltown, Weikert, Snyder-Middleswart State Park, Poe Valley State Park, Reeds Gap State Park and Siglerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
